verses.verse: But now <S%H6258><s%> they that are younger <S%H6810><s%> <S%H3117><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> I have me in derision, <S%H7832><s%> <S%H5921><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> fathers <S%H1><s%> I would have disdained <S%H3988><s%> to have set <S%H7896><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> the dogs <S%H3611><s%> of my flock. <S%H6629><s%>
Yea, <S%H1571><s%> whereto <S%H4100><s%> might the strength <S%H3581><s%> of their hands <S%H3027><s%> profit me, in whom <S%H5921><s%> old age <S%H3624><s%> was perished? <S%H6><s%>

For want <S%H2639><s%> and famine <S%H3720><s%> they were solitary; <S%H1565><s%> fleeing <S%H6207><s%> into the wilderness <S%H6723><s%> in former time <S%H570><s%> desolate <S%H7722><s%> and waste. <S%H4875><s%>
Who cut up <S%H6998><s%> mallows <S%H4408><s%> by <S%H5921><s%> the bushes, <S%H7880><s%> and juniper <S%H7574><s%> roots <S%H8328><s%> for their meat. <S%H3899><s%>
They were driven forth <S%H1644><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> among <S%H1460><s%> men, (they cried <S%H7321><s%> after <S%H5921><s%> them as after a thief;) <S%H1590><s%>
To dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the clefts <S%H6178><s%> of the valleys, <S%H5158><s%> in caves <S%H2356><s%> of the earth, <S%H6083><s%> and in the rocks. <S%H3710><s%>
Among <S%H996><s%> the bushes <S%H7880><s%> they brayed; <S%H5101><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the nettles <S%H2738><s%> they were gathered together. <S%H5596><s%>

They were children <S%H1121><s%> of fools, <S%H5036><s%> yea, <S%H1571><s%> children <S%H1121><s%> of base men: <S%H1097><s%> <S%H8034><s%> they were viler <S%H5217><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%>
And now <S%H6258><s%> am <S%H1961><s%> I their song, <S%H5058><s%> yea, I am <S%H1961><s%> their byword. <S%H4405><s%>
They abhor <S%H8581><s%> me, they flee far <S%H7368><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> me, and spare <S%H2820><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> to spit <S%H7536><s%> in my face. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%>

Because <S%H3588><s%> he hath loosed <S%H6605><s%> my cord, <S%H3499><s%> and afflicted <S%H6031><s%> me, they have also let loose <S%H7971><s%> the bridle <S%H7448><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> me.

Upon <S%H5921><s%> my right <S%H3225><s%> hand rise <S%H6965><s%> the youth; <S%H6526><s%> they push away <S%H7971><s%> my feet, <S%H7272><s%> and they raise up <S%H5549><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me the ways <S%H734><s%> of their destruction. <S%H343><s%>
They mar <S%H5420><s%> my path, <S%H5410><s%> they set forward <S%H3276><s%> my calamity, <S%H1942><s%> they have no <S%H3808><s%> helper. <S%H5826><s%>
They came <S%H857><s%> upon me as a wide <S%H7342><s%> breaking in <S%H6556><s%> of waters: in <S%H8478><s%> the desolation <S%H7722><s%> they rolled themselves <S%H1556><s%> upon me.

Terrors <S%H1091><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me: they pursue <S%H7291><s%> my soul <S%H5082><s%> as the wind: <S%H7307><s%> and my welfare <S%H3444><s%> passeth away <S%H5674><s%> as a cloud. <S%H5645><s%>
And now <S%H6258><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> is poured out <S%H8210><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me; the days <S%H3117><s%> of affliction <S%H6040><s%> have taken hold upon <S%H270><s%> me.
My bones <S%H6106><s%> are pierced <S%H5365><s%> in <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> me in the night season: <S%H3915><s%> and my sinews <S%H6207><s%> take no rest. <S%H7901><s%> <S%H3808><s%>
By the great <S%H7230><s%> force <S%H3581><s%> of my disease is my garment <S%H3830><s%> changed: <S%H2664><s%> it bindeth me about <S%H247><s%> as the collar <S%H6310><s%> of my coat. <S%H3801><s%>
He hath cast <S%H3384><s%> me into the mire, <S%H2563><s%> and I am become <S%H4911><s%> like dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes. <S%H665><s%>
I cry <S%H7768><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> thee, and thou dost not <S%H3808><s%> hear <S%H6030><s%> me: I stand up, <S%H5975><s%> and thou regardest <S%H995><s%> me not.
Thou art become <S%H2015><s%> cruel <S%H393><s%> to me: with thy strong <S%H6108><s%> hand <S%H3027><s%> thou opposest thyself against <S%H7852><s%> me.
Thou liftest me up <S%H5375><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the wind; <S%H7307><s%> thou causest me to ride <S%H7392><s%> upon it, and dissolvest <S%H4127><s%> my substance. <S%H7738><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that thou wilt bring <S%H7725><s%> me to death, <S%H4194><s%> and to the house <S%H1004><s%> appointed <S%H4150><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> living. <S%H2416><s%>

Howbeit <S%H389><s%> he will not <S%H3808><s%> stretch out <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> to the grave, <S%H1164><s%> though <S%H518><s%> they cry <S%H7769><s%> in his destruction. <S%H6365><s%>
Did not <S%H3808><s%> I weep <S%H1058><s%> for him that was in trouble? <S%H7186><s%> <S%H3117><s%> was not my soul <S%H5315><s%> grieved <S%H5701><s%> for the poor? <S%H34><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> I looked for <S%H6960><s%> good, <S%H2896><s%> then evil <S%H7451><s%> came <S%H935><s%> unto me: and when I waited <S%H3176><s%> for light, <S%H216><s%> there came <S%H935><s%> darkness. <S%H652><s%>
My bowels <S%H4578><s%> boiled, <S%H7570><s%> and rested <S%H1826><s%> not: <S%H3808><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of affliction <S%H6040><s%> prevented <S%H6923><s%> me.
I went <S%H1980><s%> mourning <S%H6937><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> the sun: <S%H2535><s%> I stood up, <S%H6965><s%> and I cried <S%H7768><s%> in the congregation. <S%H6951><s%>
I am <S%H1961><s%> a brother <S%H251><s%> to dragons, <S%H8577><s%> and a companion <S%H7453><s%> to owls. <S%H1323><s%> <S%H3284><s%>
My skin <S%H5785><s%> is black <S%H7835><s%> upon <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> me, and my bones <S%H6106><s%> are burned <S%H2787><s%> with <S%H4480><s%> heat. <S%H2721><s%>
My harp <S%H3658><s%> also is <S%H1961><s%> turned to mourning, <S%H60><s%> and my organ <S%H5748><s%> into the voice <S%H6963><s%> of them that weep. <S%H1058><s%>
